DataElement.preferredName: Johns Hopkins Frailty Assessment Calculator During Past 2 Weeks Have Participated in Regular Exercise Program Indicator Average Hour Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response, during the past two weeks, of the average amount of hours they have participated in any regular exercise program, such as stretching or strengthening exercises, swimming or any other regular exercise program.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Johns Hopkins Frailty Assessment Calculator During Past 2 Weeks Have Participated in Regular Exercise Program Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0)._At some point in a given period of time._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about whether an individual has participated in a regular exercise program, such as stretching or strengthening exercises, swimming, or any other regular exercise program._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0).

Concepts.definition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0).

Property.preferredName: During Past 2 Weeks Have Participated in Regular Exercise Program Indicator

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.
A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.

Concepts.longName: Have Participated in Regular Exercise Program
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has participated in a regular exercise program, such as stretching or strengthening exercises, swimming or any other regular exercise program.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time in hours that it takes for an event or activity to take place from beginning to end.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
